s.text: Most of them were performed on poor women who could not muster the money to pay for abortions earlier in their pregnancies.
Most of them were performed on poor women who could not muster the money to pay for abortions earlier in their pregnancies.
You might think, from the attention paid to Ron Fitzsimmons' recantation, that he was a major player in the abortion debate.

None of the groups that provides reliable statistics about abortion tallies up the total numbers of IDEs.
But the pro-life movement recognizes it has lost the larger debate, and has therefore adopted a step-by-step strategy.
If abortion is not wrong--irrespective of the circumstances--then the issue becomes a tradeoff among unpleasant alternatives.
